---
category: news
title: "Infants exposed to antibiotics after birth have altered recognition memory responses at one month of age"
excerpt: "Neonatal exposure to antibiotics, in the absence of infection, results in abnormal learning and memory in animals and is linked to changes in gut microbes. The relevance of early-life antibiotic exposure to brain function in humans is not known."
publishedDateTime: 2020-09-12T16:24:00Z
